Dear Ms. French:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
6/2/2021. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules. As indicated above substantial compliance has been established
therefore, your certificate of inspection license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
322 E. Stockbridge Ave
Kalamazoo, MI 49001
(269) 251-2471

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
The facility is not contracted with MDHHS.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
The facility is not contracted with MDHHS.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Several items within their electronic filing system were not always coded
consistently. The importance of consistent coding was discussed, and the
facility will look into developing a system to accomplish this standard.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Several times, during this inspection, information had to be gathered from
several different sources. It was suggested that they place all information in
their electronic file as a way to consolidate the information.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. This CAP submitted was in response to
their 2020 Licensing Interim inspection.
Staff and residents were interviewed during this inspection. All of the residents report
feeling safe and well cared for at the facility. They also reported staff are consistently
observing them and provide support for any issues they present. They report being
engaged in therapy and having numerous activities to engage in during the typical
day. Residents report the food is “good” and they have their needs met on a regular
basis. Staff interviewed report a desire to provide “best practice” for the residents in
4

all areas such as the treatment and detention programs. Although they reported in the
past difficulty with COVID-19, they felt supported by administration and having the
residents well taken care of as required.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
6/3/2021

Paul Fatato Date
